H0.text: Help eliminate body wastes is what the skin, lungs, and kidneys work together to do.

H1.text: Help blood circulate is the function that the skin, lungs, and kidneys perform together.

H2.text: Aid in digestion is the function performed by the skin, lungs, and kidneys working together.

H3.text: Aid in respiration is achieved by the skin, lungs, and kidneys working together.

A4.text: Sweat glands in the skin secrete a fluid waste called sweat or perspiration; however, its primary functions are temperature control and pheromone release.

A5.text: The moist, scale-less skin is therefore essential in helping to rid the blood of carbon dioxide, and also allows for urea to be expelled through diffusion when submerged.

A6.text: The kidney participates in the control of the volume of various body fluids, fluid osmolality, acidâ€“base balance, various electrolyte concentrations, and removal of toxins.

A7.text: In nephrotic syndrome, the glomerulus has been damaged so that a large amount of protein in the blood enters the urine.
